case_vignette: A 30-year-old male presents for evaluation of a dark discoloration on the posterior thighs present for the past month. He denies any topical products applied to the area. He denies any pain or pruritus at the area. He has not tried any treatments. The rash has been stable in size, is constant, and is not significantly growing in size. He works a desk job and reports sitting on a seat warmer over the past several years. Physical examination reveals reticulated lacy brown patches on the posterior thighs and lower buttocks.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a dark discoloration on the back of my thighs that's been there for about a month.
Has the discoloration changed in size or color since you first noticed it?
No, the discoloration has been stable in size and has not significantly grown or changed in color.
Do you have any associated symptoms like itching, pain, or any other discomfort in that area?
No, I don't have any pain, itching, or other discomfort in that area.
Do you have a personal or family history of skin conditions or any other relevant health issues?
I don't have any personal or family history of skin conditions or other relevant health issues.
Have you recently experienced any trauma, friction, or pressure on the area where the discoloration appears?
Yes, I have been sitting on a seat warmer at my desk job, which could be causing pressure on the area.
Final Diagnosis: Erythema ab igne
